title: Lattice strain and texture development in coarse-grained uranium – a neutron diffraction study
summary: This paper presents the results of a neutron diffraction experiment on coarse-grained cast uranium under tension and compression. The study focuses on lattice strain accumulation and texture changes due to deformation, providing insights into the material's behavior.
methodology: The authors used a combination of single-peak fitting and Rietveld refinement methods to analyze the neutron diffraction data. They also employed digital image correlation to measure displacement and calculate strain.
research_outcomes: The study found that twinning is the dominant plastic deformation mechanism in coarse-grained uranium, and that lattice rotations associated with twinning occur at yield. The authors also observed a clear similarity in the lattice strain response between two specimens deformed in tension.

title: Synthesis and investigation of a self-assembled hydrogel based on hydroxyethyl cellulose and its in vitro ibuprofen drug release characteristics
summary: This paper investigates the synthesis of a self-assembled hydrogel based on hydroxyethyl cellulose (HEC) and its in vitro ibuprofen drug release characteristics. The study focuses on the formation of inclusion complexes between HEC and b-cyclodextrin (b-CDP), which enhances the solubility of ibuprofen. The authors prepare a self-assembled hydrogel, gel-(b)CDP-HEC/IBU, with sustained release characteristics over 1440 min.
methodology: The study employs a Williamson etherification reaction to synthesize HEC-C12 and b-CDP. The authors then prepare the self-assembled hydrogel by mixing equal volumes of aqueous solutions of b-CDP/IBU and HEC-C12.
research_outcomes: The study demonstrates that the self-assembled hydrogel exhibits sustained release characteristics over 1440 min, with a loaded content of ibuprofen in gel-(b)CDP-HEC/IBU being 5 wt%. The results also show that the Korsmeyer-Peppas kinetic model gives a better correlation for the release of ibuprofen.

title: The effect of doping graphene oxide on the structure and property of polyimide-based graphite fibre
summary: This paper investigates the effect of doping graphene oxide (GO) on the structure and properties of polyimide-based graphite fibres. The authors prepared GO/PI composite fibres with different GO contents and found that the incorporation of GO improved the thermal stability, reduced exothermic intensity during carbonization, and increased the degree of graphitization.
methodology: The authors used a combination of experimental techniques, including Fourier transform infrared spectroscopy (FTIR), scanning electron microscopy (SEM), thermal gravimetric analysis (TG)/differential scanning calorimetry (DSC), X-ray diffraction (XRD), and Raman spectroscopy to investigate the structure and properties of GO/PI composite fibres.
research_outcomes: The study found that the incorporation of GO improved the thermal stability, reduced exothermic intensity during carbonization, and increased the degree of graphitization. The authors also found that the mechanical property and thermal conductivity of the GO/PI composite fibres were improved.

title: Limit State of a Rectangular Reinforced Section Using Elastoplastic Material Strain Diagrams
summary: This paper presents a methodology for constructing the strength domain of a reinforced rectangular section made of elastoplastic materials. The research focuses on developing a simpler technique for constructing the strength area without solving optimization problems, using linear and quadratic functions to describe the boundary of the strength region.
methodology: The paper uses standard programs to solve an extreme problem and construct the strength area by analyzing equilibrium equations and stress diagrams in reinforcement and bending center coordinate changes.
research_outcomes: The study proposes a simpler technique for constructing the strength area of a rectangular reinforced cross-section without solving optimization problems, using linear and quadratic functions to describe the boundary of the strength region.

title: Ab-initio study of mechanical and electronic properties of MoAlB
summary: This paper investigates the structural, elastic, and electronic properties of MoAlB using first-principles calculations. The study finds that MoAlB is mechanically stable and exhibits a high Debye temperature, making it a good thermal conductor. However, the material's brittleness suggests that it may not be suitable for certain applications.
methodology: The authors used first-principles calculations based on density functional theory (DFT) to investigate the properties of MoAlB.
research_outcomes: The study found that MoAlB is mechanically stable and exhibits a high Debye temperature, making it a good thermal conductor. However, the material's brittleness suggests that it may not be suitable for certain applications.

title: NO2 Sensing Properties of Cr2WO6 Gas Sensor in Air and N2 Atmospheres
summary: This paper investigates the sensing properties of Cr2WO6 gas sensors for NO2 detection in air and N2 atmospheres. The study finds that the sensor responses are highly temperature-dependent and increase with reduction in temperatures, but no machine learning or AI methods are used.
methodology: The methodology involves fabricating Cr2WO6 nanoparticles using a wet chemistry method followed by hydrothermal treatment, and then characterizing their sensing properties to NO2 in both dry and humid conditions.
research_outcomes: The study finds that the sensor responses are highly temperature-dependent and increase with reduction in temperatures. The limit of detection (LOD) of NO2 for Cr2WO6 nanoparticles is better than 1 ppm.

title: Efficient Conversion of Nitrogen to Nitrogen-Vacancy Centers in Diamond Particles with High-Temperature Electron Irradiation
summary: This paper investigates the efficient conversion of nitrogen to nitrogen-vacancy centers in diamond particles using high-temperature electron irradiation. The authors demonstrate a significant increase in NV concentration with up to 25% conversion yield, outperforming conventional room temperature irradiation methods.
methodology: The authors used high-energy (10 MeV) electron irradiation and simultaneous annealing at 800°C to create vacancies and recombine them with nitrogen atoms. They compared the results with conventional room temperature irradiation and found a higher NV concentration in the high-temperature irradiated samples.
research_outcomes: The study demonstrates the effectiveness of high-temperature electron irradiation for creating NV centers in diamond particles, with up to 25% conversion yield. The results have implications for the production of fluorescent nanodiamonds and other applications where NV centers are required.

title: Effect of Bleaching Agents on Mineral Trioxide Aggregate
summary: This study investigates the effect of bleaching agents with neutral pH on the surface of mineral trioxide aggregate (MTA) using electron microscopy and energy dispersive X-ray microanalysis. The results show no relevant changes in color or statistically significant surface structure changes of MTA after exposure to Opalescence Boost 40% HP and Opalescence 10% carbamide peroxide bleaching agents.
methodology: The study used a standard powder/liquid ratio for MTA, maintained in a container with 100% relative humidity at room temperature for 21 days. The samples were then exposed to bleaching agents according to the manufacturers' instructions and observed using scanning electron microscopy and energy-dispersive X-ray analysis.
research_outcomes: The study found no statistically significant difference in levels of Al, Bi, Ca, Mg, and Si between the groups. The results suggest that bleaching agents with neutral pH do not affect the surface structure of MTA.

title: Effect of Hybrid Carbon Fillers on the Electrical and Morphological Properties of Polystyrene Nanocomposites in Microinjection Molding
summary: This paper investigates the effect of hybrid carbon fillers on the electrical and morphological properties of polystyrene nanocomposites in microinjection molding. The study finds that high structure CB is more effective than CNT in enhancing electrical conductivity, but does not involve any machine learning or AI methods.
methodology: The authors used melt blending and microinjection molding to prepare polystyrene nanocomposites with hybrid carbon fillers. They investigated the effect of filler concentration and weight ratio on electrical and morphological properties.
research_outcomes: The study found that high structure CB is more effective than CNT in enhancing electrical conductivity, but does not involve any machine learning or AI methods.

title: Fe3O4 Nanoparticles for Complex Targeted Delivery and Boron Neutron Capture Therapy
summary: This paper presents the modification of Fe3O4 nanoparticles with (3-aminopropyl)-trimethoxysilane and subsequent attachment with carborane borate for potential use in boron neutron capture therapy. The study focuses on the stability, biocompatibility, and toxicity of the modified nanoparticles.
methodology: The methodology involves co-precipitation of iron oxide nanoparticles followed by amine functionalization and carborane immobilization.
research_outcomes: The study shows excellent stability, biocompatibility, and reduced toxicity of the modified nanoparticles.

title: Preparation and molten salt corrosion behaviors of TiO2/Al2O3/Incone1625 composite coatings on the surface of Q235 alloy at 900 °C
summary: This paper investigates the preparation and molten salt corrosion behaviors of TiO2/Al2O3/Incone1625 composite coatings on the surface of Q235 alloy at 900 °C. The study uses a combination of sol-gel method and plasma surfacing technology to prepare the composite coating, which is then tested for its corrosion resistance in a molten salt environment.
methodology: The methodology involves preparing TiO2/Al2O3/Incone1625 composite coatings on the surface of Q235 alloy using sol-gel method and plasma surfacing technology. The samples are then tested for their corrosion resistance in a molten salt environment at 900 °C.
research_outcomes: The study shows that the TiO2/Al2O3/Incone1625 composite coating improves the molten salt corrosion resistance of Q235 alloy at 900 °C. The results indicate that the composite coating promotes the formation of a compact oxide film on the sample surface, which effectively prevents inner oxidation of the matrix.

title: Main 3D Manufacturing Techniques for Customized Bone Substitutes. A Systematic Review
summary: This systematic review aims to identify the main methods and materials used in manufacturing customized bone scaffolds through 3D technology. The study focuses on techniques such as SLA, Robocasting, and FDM, which are promising options for customized bone regeneration.
methodology: Systematic review of existing literature
research_outcomes: The study identified 14 techniques for manufacturing customized bone scaffolds, with SLA, Robocasting, and FDM being promising options. The use of biocomposites has been shown to provide greater advantages for bone regeneration.

title: Production of nanopowders of bismuth oxide doped with silver by pulsed electron beam evaporation in vacuum
summary: This paper presents an environmentally friendly method for producing Ag-doped Bi2O3 nanoparticles using pulsed electron beam evaporation in vacuum. The study focuses on the synthesis and characterization of these nanoparticles, exploring their textural, thermal, and magnetic properties.
methodology: The authors employed a solid phase synthesis method to prepare the Ag-doped Bi2O3 targets, followed by pulsed electron beam evaporation in vacuum. The resulting nanoparticles were characterized using X-ray diffraction, nitrogen adsorption-desorption isotherms, and thermal analysis.
research_outcomes: The study found that the Ag-doped Bi2O3 nanoparticles exhibit improved textural and thermal properties compared to pure Bi2O3. The presence of silver was shown to increase the specific surface area and pore volume of the nanoparticles.

title: Emergence of strong room-temperature ferroelectricity and multiferroicity in 2D-Ti$_3$C$_2$T$_x$ free-standing MXene film
summary: This paper reports the emergence of strong room-temperature ferroelectricity and multiferroicity in 2D-Ti$_3$C$_2$T$_x$ free-standing MXene film. The authors employed a simple synthesis approach to develop ferroelectric and multiferroic 2D materials, specifically in the new class of materials called MXenes.
methodology: The authors used a combination of chemical etching and delamination processes to synthesize the Ti$_3$C$_2$T$_x$ MXene film. The structural and phase transformations were studied through analysis of Raman spectra and X-ray diffraction patterns.
research_outcomes: The authors observed a clear ferroelectric hysteresis effect in the TiO$_2$/Ti$_3$C$_2$T$_x$ composite, indicating the presence of ferroelectricity. They also observed a multiferroic behavior in the material, with both ferromagnetism and ferroelectricity present simultaneously.

title: Complexity of Secure Sets
summary: This paper investigates the complexity of secure sets in graphs, a concept that generalizes defensive alliances. The authors provide a precise complexity-theoretic classification of the problem and show that it is P2-complete. They also analyze the parameterized complexity of the problem with treewidth as the parameter and show that it is hard for the class W[1].
methodology: The authors use a combination of theoretical results and algorithmic techniques to analyze the complexity of secure sets.
research_outcomes: The main contributions of this paper are the precise complexity-theoretic classification of the Secure Set problem and the parameterized hardness result for treewidth as the parameter.

title: A LiAlO2/nitrogen-doped hollow carbon spheres (NdHCSs) modified separator for advanced lithium–sulfur batteries
summary: This paper presents a novel double-layer lithium aluminate/nitrogen-doped hollow carbon sphere (LiAlO2/NdHCSs)-modified separator for advanced lithium-sulfur batteries. The LiAlO2/NdHCSs-modified separator shows improved electrochemical performance, with an initial discharge capacity of 1500 mA h g−1 at 0.2C and a discharge capacity of 543.3 mA h g−1 after 500 cycles at 2C.
methodology: The LiAlO2/NdHCSs-modified separator was prepared by a two-step casting procedure, with LiAlO2 mixed with PVDF and coated on a piece of polymer separator. The NdHCSs/PVDF slurry was then applied on the top of the LiAlO2 layer.
research_outcomes: The LiAlO2/NdHCSs-modified separator shows improved electrochemical performance, with an initial discharge capacity of 1500 mA h g−1 at 0.2C and a discharge capacity of 543.3 mA h g−1 after 500 cycles at 2C.

title: Design of Asymmetric Nanofibers-Membranes Based on Polyvinyl Alcohol and Wool-Keratin for Wound Healing Applications
summary: This paper presents the design of asymmetric nanofibers-membranes based on polyvinyl alcohol and wool-keratin for wound healing applications. The research focuses on developing biomaterials with tunable properties to support all phases of the wound healing process, but does not involve machine learning or artificial intelligence methods.
methodology: The methodology involves electrospinning a sequential process to fabricate asymmetric membranes with cross-linked polyvinylalcohol (PVA) nanofibers and wool-keratin. Morphological characterization via SEM, water contact angle measurements, and Fourier-transform infrared spectroscopy analysis are used to evaluate the properties of the membranes.
research_outcomes: The asymmetric membrane exhibited average fiber size and porosity suitable for wound healing applications. Keratin/PVA-NFs showed a significant improvement in cell adhesion compared to pure PVA-NFs.

title: Simulation of Physical and Mechanical Properties to Increase the Strength of the Cutting Ceramics
summary: This paper focuses on simulating physical and mechanical properties to increase the strength of cutting ceramics. The research explores the effects of high-temperature plastic deformation, diffusion, and interatomic bond strength on the material's behavior. However, machine learning or artificial intelligence methods are not used in this study.
methodology: The authors employ a combination of theoretical modeling and experimental analysis to investigate the properties of cutting ceramics under high-temperature conditions.
research_outcomes: The study reveals that high-temperature plastic deformation, diffusion, and interatomic bond strength play significant roles in determining the material's behavior. The authors also identify potential strategies for improving the strength of cutting ceramics through alloying and thermal treatment.

title: Understanding Material Removal Mechanism and Effects of Machining Parameters during EDM of Zirconia-Toughened Alumina Ceramic
summary: This paper investigates the material removal mechanism and effects of machining parameters on machining speed and dimensional and profile accuracies of features machined on zirconia toughened alumina (ZTA) ceramics using assistive electrode EDM. The study focuses on the EDM machining of ZTA ceramics, which has potential applications in orthopedic prostheses, cutting tools, and wear-resistant parts.
methodology: The study uses a three-level full factorial design to evaluate both main effects as well as interaction effects among all input parameters. Twenty-seven sets of experimental trials were planned to evaluate the main parameters effect and interactive effect.
research_outcomes: The results demonstrate that both increasing peak current and pulse on time improves the MRR, however, it also aids in generating thicker layer on machined surface. Pulse interval time is crucial for the machining of nonconductive ceramics, as larger value might cause the complete removal of intrinsic carbon layer which may lead to non/sparking condition.
sources_of_inspiration: Electro discharge machining (EDM), well known for its machining of electrically conductive materials irrespective of materials hardness
Assistive Electrode Method allows for the machining of nonconductive ceramics with the help of some metallic conductive layer on the workpiece

title: Computer-assisted design/computer-assisted manufacturing systems: A revolution in restorative dentistry
summary: This paper discusses the application of computer-assisted design and manufacturing (CAD/CAM) systems in restorative dentistry, highlighting their ability to produce precise and aesthetically pleasing restorations. The use of CAD/CAM technology is shown to overcome errors associated with traditional ceramo-metal technology.
methodology: The methodology involves the use of a CAD/CAM system to design and manufacture dental restorations, including crowns and veneers.
research_outcomes: The study demonstrates the effectiveness of CAD/CAM technology in producing high-quality dental restorations with good esthetics and precision-fit.

title: The effect of shale mineral powder on the strength of asphalt concrete
summary: This paper investigates the impact of shale mineral powder on the physical and mechanical properties of asphalt concrete. The authors develop a new technology to obtain shale mineral powder from local raw materials, which improves the strength and durability of asphalt concrete.
methodology: The composition of asphalt concrete was studied in laboratory work using technologies for obtaining shale mineral powder based on local raw materials.
research_outcomes: The addition of mineral powder to fine-grained hot dense asphalt concrete mix increases the density, water permeability, and binder activity of the mixture, leading to improved physical and mechanical properties.

title: Simultaneous Enhancement of Mechanical and Magnetic Properties in Extremely-Fine Nanograined Ni-P Alloys
summary: This paper explores the structural effects on both mechanical strength and magnetization of extremely-fine nanograined metals, specifically Ni-P alloys. The authors investigate how annealing affects the properties of these materials, finding that it leads to a significant enhancement of both hardness and magnetization.
methodology: The study uses transmission electron microscopy (TEM) and three-dimensional atom probe tomography (3D APT) techniques to analyze the role of P on hardness and magnetization of NC Ni-P alloys. Nanoindentation tests were performed at room temperature using a TI950 TriboIndenter, and magnetization curves were measured using a vibrating sample magnetometer.
research_outcomes: The study finds that annealing leads to a significant enhancement of both hardness and magnetization in Ni-P alloys. The authors suggest that the second phase has little effect on magnetization enhancement, and essentially both structural relaxation and GB segregation can play important roles in hardening by governing GB stability, and in the improvement of magnetization by enhancing Ni–Ni atom exchange interactions.

title: Sorption of organic compounds by aged polystyrene microplastic particles
summary: This paper presents experimental sorption isotherms of 21 probe sorbates by aged polystyrene microplastics, with data modelled using linear free-energy relationships. The study focuses on the interaction between UV-aged polystyrene microplastics and organic compounds, providing valuable information for predicting sorption.
methodology: Experimental sorption isotherms were obtained using aged polystyrene microplastic particles as sorbent, with data modelled using linear free-energy relationships.
research_outcomes: Distribution coefficients between the aqueous phase and the sorbent (K d ) were calculated for all sorbates at a constant sorbate loading on aged PSMP of 1000 µg/kg, using the Freundlich equation.

title: Piezoelectric Properties of PVDF-Zn2GeO4 Fine Fiber Mats
summary: This paper presents the development and characterization of polyvinylidene fluoride (PVDF)-Zn2GeO4 fine fiber mats, which show promising piezoelectric properties. The study focuses on synthesizing Zn2GeO4 nanorods and incorporating them into a PVDF matrix using the Forcespinning method.
methodology: The methodology involves synthesizing Zn2GeO4 nanorods using the hydrothermal method, followed by incorporation into a PVDF solution. The mixture is then spun into fine fiber mats using the Forcespinning method.
research_outcomes: The study finds that the developed PVDF-ZGO fiber-based composite exhibits promising piezoelectric and photoluminescence properties, which may open up new applications where both characteristics are utilized simultaneously.

title: Properties of Poly(3-hydroxybutyrate-co-3-hydroxyvalerate)/Polycaprolactone Polymer Mixtures Reinforced by Cellulose Nanocrystals: Experimental and Simulation Studies
summary: This paper investigates the properties of poly(3-hydroxybutyrate-co-3-hydroxyvalerate)/polycaprolactone (PHBV/PCL) polymer mixtures reinforced by cellulose nanocrystals (CNCs). The study focuses on the morphological, sorption, thermal, and mechanical properties of the obtained composites. No machine learning or AI methods are used in this research.
methodology: Experimental and simulation studies were conducted to investigate the properties of PHBV/PCL/CNC composites. The classical molecular dynamics (MD) simulation was carried out using the GPU version of GROMACS 5.0.7.
research_outcomes: The study found that CNCs can either induce crystallization and polymer crystallite growth or act as a compatibilizer of a mixture of polymers causing their amorphization. The addition of CNCs significantly reduces the elongation and strength of the composites, but changes Young's modulus insignificantly.
